fields.title: Create Project
fields.description: Create a new project on Health Data Nexus.

fields.title: Preparing for Submission
fields.content:
To prepare the project for submission, go through the following steps using the side panel:

  1. Invite authors to be credited for creating the resource.
  2. Fill in the descriptive metadata.
  3. Set the access policy and license.
  4. Add discovery information.
  5. Upload the files.
  6. Proofread the project and make sure it is ready for submission.

The full publishing process is described in the author guidelines.

fields.title: Project Authors
fields.content: The submitting author is responsible for managing co-authors and handling the project submission. Co-authors can be invited using the form below. Once the co-author is registered on {{ SITE_NAME }}, the invitation will appear on their project home page. Authors must provide their affiliation on a project-by-project basis.

fields.title: Corresponding Author
fields.content: The corresponding author is responsible for responding to inquiries from users post publication.

fields.title: Corresponding Email
fields.content: You are the selected corresponding author. Choose one of your emails to be listed for correspondence.

fields.title: Your Affiliations
fields.content: Set up to three affiliations for your author profile. Note: these fields are not tied to your user profile.

fields.title: Your Affiliations
fields.content: Institutions you are affiliated with. Maximum of 3.

fields.title: Submitting Author
fields.content: Only the submitting author of a project is able to edit content. You may transfer the role of submitting author to a co-author. Choose one of the co-authors below to make them the submitting author for this project. Transferring authorship will remove your ability to edit content!

fields.title: Project Content
fields.content:
Describe the context of your resource, the organization of its files, and how it is to be reused.


Please adhere to the standards specified in the helpstrings. Required fields are indicated by a *.

fields.title: Project Access
fields.content:
Set the access policy and terms of reuse for your resource. The descriptive metadata of all published projects are publically visible. The following access policies control access to the files:

  • Open: Anyone can access the files, as long as they conform to the terms of the specified license.
  • Restricted: Only logged in users who sign a data use agreement (DUA) for the project can access the files.
  • Credentialed: Only Health Data Nexus credentialed users who sign a DUA for the project can access the files. This tier is only for sensitive databases. Please contact us beforehand if you would like to contribute such a resource.

We strongly encourage selecting the open access policy.

fields.title: Project Discovery
fields.content: Add information to increase your project's discoverability.

fields.title: Ethics
fields.content: Please provide an ethics statement following the author guidelines. Statements on ethics approval should appear here. Your statement will be included in the public project description.

fields.title: Supporting Documentation
fields.content: You may upload supporting documents here. These documents will be reviewed by our editorial staff, but they will not be shared publicly. For further guidance, please refer to our author guidelines.

fields.title: Project Files
fields.content:
"content": "

Health Data Nexus resources should be reusable by the greater scientific community. To facilitate the reuse of your content, please adhere to the following reusability guidelines.

General Guidelines

  • Files must contain no protected health information.
  • Files are provided in an open format such as text, csv, or WFDB, rather than a proprietary format.
  • Code must be provided in source format.
  • Data files must be machine readable.
  • Large regularly-sampled time-series data, especially waveforms, are provided in WFDB format.
  • Filenames must only contain letters, numbers, dashes, underscores, and dots.
  • If appropriate, provide a csv file named subject-info.csv containing information on all subjects, such as age and gender.

WFDB Files

  • Provide a list of all WFDB format records, named RECORDS. Example file. If you upload this file, you will see a link to view your project's waveforms in LightWAVE.
  • Provide a tab delimited list of all WFDB format annotation files, named ANNOTATORS. Example file.
"

fields.title: Proofread
fields.content: Inspect the preview of the published project, and ensure that all authors are satisfied with the content. Any errors that are displayed must be addressed before the project can be submitted for review.
